member.name: T:Unosquare.FFME.Windows.Sample.Foundation.DeferredAction
member.summary: Represents a timer which performs an action on the UI thread when time elapses. Rescheduling is supported. Original code from here: https://www.codeproject.com/Articles/32426/Deferring-ListCollectionView-filter-updates-for-a address.

member.name: M:Unosquare.FFME.Windows.Sample.Foundation.DeferredAction.#ctor(System.Action{Unosquare.FFME.Windows.Sample.Foundation.DeferredAction})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Unosquare.FFME.Windows.Sample.Foundation.DeferredAction.Create(System.Action{Unosquare.FFME.Windows.Sample.Foundation.DeferredAction})
member.summary: Creates a new DeferredAction.
member.param: The action that will be deferred. It is not performed until after is called.

member.name: M:Unosquare.FFME.Windows.Sample.Foundation.DeferredAction.Defer(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Defers performing the action until after time elapses. Repeated calls will reschedule the action if it has not already been performed.
member.param: The amount of time to wait before performing the action.

member.summary: Determines if the command is currently executing.

member.summary: Defines the method that determines whether the command can execute in its current state.
member.param: Data used by the command. If the command does not require data to be passed, this object can be set to null.
member.returns: true if this command can be executed; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unosquare.FFME.Windows.Sample.Foundation.DelegateCommand.CanExecute
member.summary: Determines whether this instance can execute.
member.returns: true if this instance can execute; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Executes the command but does not wait for it to complete.

member.name: M:Unosquare.FFME.Windows.Sample.Foundation.DelegateCommand.ExecuteAsync(System.Object)
member.summary: Executes the command. This call can be awaited.

member.summary: Executes the command. This call can be awaited.

member.name: T:Unosquare.FFME.Windows.Sample.Foundation.ReactiveExtensions
member.summary: A very simple set of extensions to more easily handle UI state changes based on notification properties. The main idea is to bind to the PropertyChanged event for a publisher only one and add a set of callbacks with matching property names when the publisher raises the event.

member.summary: Contains a list of subscriptions Subscriptions[Publisher][PropertyName].List of subscriber-action pairs.

member.summary: Specifies a callback when properties change.

member.name: T:Unosquare.FFME.Windows.Sample.Foundation.TransportStreamRecorder
member.summary:
An recorder that simply copies input packets into an output file. Loosely based on the ideas from https://github.com/FFmpeg/FFmpeg/blob/5252d594a155cdb0a0e2529961b999cda96f0fa5/doc/examples/remuxing.c#L80 This example does not cover re-encoding. Only re-muxing packets into a file. For re-encoding you will need to handle the following events and perform encoding on your own
.

member.name: M:Unosquare.FFME.Windows.Sample.Foundation.TransportStreamRecorder.#ctor(System.String,Unosquare.FFME.MediaElement)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The output file path. The extension will be guessed according to the input.

member.name: M:Unosquare.FFME.Windows.Sample.Foundation.TransportStreamRecorder.Close
member.summary: Writes the file trailer and releases the output context and file. Make sure you call this method when finishing the capture process.

member.name: M:Unosquare.FFME.Windows.Sample.Foundation.TransportStreamRecorder.Release
member.summary: Releases unmanaged resources and prevents more packets from being handled.

member.name: M:Unosquare.FFME.Windows.Sample.Foundation.TransportStreamRecorder.GuessOutputFilePath(FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext*)
member.summary: Guesses the file path with an appropriate extension according to the input context.
member.returns: A suitable file path with appropriate file extension.

member.name: M:Unosquare.FFME.Windows.Sample.Foundation.TransportStreamRecorder.Initialize(FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext*)
member.summary: Initializes the output context and writes the file header.

member.name: M:Unosquare.FFME.Windows.Sample.Foundation.TransportStreamRecorder.OnMediaPacketRead(System.Object,Unosquare.FFME.Common.PacketReadEventArgs)
member.summary: Handles the Media.PacketRead event writing the packet to the output context.
member.param: the media element that sent this event.
The event arguments containing the packet data.
